rules: Rule1: If the food truck requires inspection, then it is operating.
Rule2: Provided that the food truck commits a minor violation, it is not the case that it violates regulations.
Rule3: The food truck commits a minor violation or it commits a major violation.
Rule4: In the event that the food truck commits a major violation, it does not violate regulations.
Rule5: Whenever the food truck commits a temperature violation, it is not the case that it violates regulations.
Rule6: Either the food truck commits a temperature violation or it commits a sanitation violation.
Rule7: Suspension is ordered for the food truck, or if it is not the case that when it commits a sanitation violation then it does not violate regulations, a warning is issued to the food truck.
Rule8: If the inspector approves the food truck, then suspension is not ordered for the food truck.
Rule9: Provided that the supervisor confirms the food truck, the inspector approves the food truck.

Rule10: If the food truck undergoes a first inspection, then whenever it is not the case that if it violates regulations then corrective action is taken for the food truck, a fine is levied on the food truck.

Rule11: In the event that the food truck undergoes a follow-up inspection, then under the condition that it is not the case that if it violates regulations then corrective action is taken for the food truck, a fine is levied on the food truck.
Rule12: Whenever the food truck undergoes a routine check, then if it is not the case that it undergoes a first inspection or it undergoes a follow-up inspection, it undergoes a comprehensive review.

Rule13: Provided that the food truck undergoes a complaint investigation, then in the event that it is not the case that it undergoes a first inspection or it undergoes a follow-up inspection, it undergoes a comprehensive review.
Rule14: The food truck operates legally, or if it does not require inspection, then it has a valid permit.
Rule15: If the food truck passes the health inspection, then it receives a certificate.
Rule16: The food truck passes the health inspection or it fails the health inspection.
Rule17: In the event that the food truck fails the health inspection, it is not the case that it operates legally.
Rule18: Whenever the food truck receives a certificate, it does not operate legally.
Rule19: Under the condition that the food truck serves alcohol, it has a liquor license.
Rule20: The food truck serves alcohol or it is operating.
Rule21: Provided that the food truck violates regulations, it is not the case that corrective action is taken for the food truck.
Rule22: The food truck violates regulations or it does not have a liquor license.
Rule23: In the event that it is not the case that if the food truck commits a sanitation violation then it does not violate regulations, it is not the case that a warning is issued to the food truck.
Rule24: Provided that it is not the case that the food truck undergoes a first inspection or it undergoes a follow-up inspection, it is not the case that it undergoes a comprehensive review.

Rule25: If it is not the case that the food truck is subject to emergency closure or it undergoes a routine check or it undergoes a complaint investigation, a public notice is issued for the food truck.

Rule26: Under the condition that it is not the case that the food truck is subject to emergency closure or it undergoes a routine check or it undergoes a complaint investigation, it is not the case that a public notice is issued for the food truck.
facts: Fact1: The supervisor confirms the food truck.
Fact2: It is not the case that a fine is levied on the food truck.
Fact3: It is not the case that the food truck has a valid permit.
Fact4: It is not the case that the food truck is subject to emergency closure.
